citeinfo.origin: Director, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USF&WS)
citeinfo.title: BERPAC; A program for long-term ecological research of ecosystems of the Bering and Chukchi Seas and the Pacific Ocean

abstract.p: Deterioration of ecosystems on a large scale threatens many functional equilibria in the biosphere. This problem is particularly urgent for the World Ocean, which is the sink for many different pollutants that can produce significant ecological impacts. This report is a planning document for BERPAC that discusses marine ecosystems, including biological, physical and biogeochemical cycles.

[Reference: Turner, J.F., H.J. O'Connor, Y.A. Izrael, and A.V. Tsyban. 1990?. BERPAC : a program for long-term ecological research of ecosystems of the Bering and Chukchi Seas and the Pacific Ocean. National Fund for the Patuxent Wildlife Research Center, 13022 8th Street, Bowie, Maryland 20720. 12 p.]
This volume may be found at many university libraries.

descript.purpose: Planning BERPAC: A program for long-term ecological research of ecosystems of the Bering and Chukchi Seas and the Pacific Ocean.
